member.name: T:Helpers.Base64Helper
member.summary: Provides methods for working with Base64 encoding and decoding.

member.name: M:Helpers.Base64Helper.SafeConvertFromBase64String(System.String)
member.summary:
Safely decodes a Base64-encoded string into a byte array.
The method replaces URL-safe characters ('-' and '_') with the standard Base64 characters ('+' and '/'). It then ensures that the string length is a multiple of 4 by appending '=' padding characters as necessary.
If the input string is null, empty, or consists only of white spaces, the method returns an empty byte array. In case of any errors during the decoding process (e.g., if the input is not valid Base64), the method also returns an empty byte array.
member.returns: A byte array representing the decoded data, or an empty byte array if the input is invalid or an error occurs.

member.name: M:Helpers.Base64Helper.EncodeToBase64String(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a byte array into a Base64-encoded string.
member.returns: A Base64-encoded string representing the input byte array, or an empty string if the input is null or empty.

member.name: M:Helpers.Base64Helper.ConvertFromBase64String(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes a Base64-encoded string into a byte array with an option to throw an exception if the input is invalid.
member.param: If set to true, throws an exception when the input is invalid.
member.returns: A byte array representing the decoded data, or an empty byte array if the input is invalid and is false.
member.exception: Thrown if the input is not a valid Base64 string and is true.
